dudu.pregunta: What is a standard?
A standard is a document, established by an authority, custom, or general consent as a model or example.

A standard is a document, established by consensus and approved by a recognized body, that provides, for common and repeated use, rules, guidelines or characteristics for activities or their results, aimed at the achievement of the optimum degree of order in a given context.
The ability to apply software development and maintenance methodologies and procedures of the highest professional level is a benefit of using standards.
Better mutual understanding and coordination among development teams is a benefit of using standards.
Greater cooperation with external participants in the project is a benefit of using standards.
Better understanding and cooperation between suppliers and customers is a benefit of using standards.
Do you know some standard?
Environment management is a type of standard.
Security is a type of standard.
Information management is a type of standard.
ISO/IEC 15948 is a standard.
ISO 32000-1 is a standard.
IEEE (Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers) Computer Society is an organization involved in standards development.
ISO (International Organization for Standardization) is an organization involved in standards development.
DOD (US Department of Defense) is an organization involved in standards development.
ANSI (American National Standards Institute) is an organization involved in standards development.
IEC (International Electrotechnical Commission) is an organization involved in standards development.
EIA (Electronic Industries Association) is an organization involved in standards development.
The provision of updated international standards is a way to contribute to standards development.

testete.pergunta: What is a standard, according to ISO/IEC TR 29110-1:2016?

alternativas.A: Document established by an authority, custom, or general consent as a model or example
alternativas.B: Document, established by consensus and approved by a recognized body, that provides, for common and repeated use, rules, guidelines or characteristics for activities or their results, aimed at the achievement of the optimum degree of order in a given context
alternativas.C: The provision of updated international standards
